snippet: As more victims go public and more of them file formal federal complaints, activists are making shrewd use of the law and the media to force schools to change their approach to assaults.
abstract: New network of activists is making shrewd use of law and media to address issue of campus sexual assaults, as more victims go public and file formal federal complaints; storm of attention about issue has forced university administrators across the country to pay more attention to how they deal with assaults.

byline.original: By RICHARD PÉREZ-PEÑA and KATE TAYLOR

lead_paragraph: As more victims go public and more of them file formal federal complaints, activists are making shrewd use of the law and the media to force schools to change their approach to assaults.

headline.main: Fight Against Sexual Assaults Holds Colleges to Account
headline.print_headline: Fight Against Sex Assaults Holds Colleges to Account
